key_points: A tragic shooting occurred on the 'Rust' movie set on October 21, 2021, resulting in one fatality and another injured.
Cast and crew were rehearsing a scene after lunch on the Bonanza Creek Ranch set in Santa Fe, New Mexico when the incident happened.
Alec Baldwin, portraying a character, was rehearsing with a prop gun that discharged, fatally wounding cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and injuring director Joel Souza.
Assistant director Dave Halls handed the prop gun to Baldwin, announcing it as a 'cold gun,' implying it was safe and unloaded.
A 911 call from the script supervisor reported the accidental shooting and requested immediate help, indicating confusion over the gun's loaded state.
Halyna Hutchins, 42, was airlifted to a hospital but was pronounced dead. Joel Souza suffered a gunshot wound but survived.
Investigators seized Baldwin's clothes and the prop gun among other items to gather evidence.
The production company expressed its intention to cooperate with the ongoing investigation.
Alec Baldwin and armorer Hannah Gutierrez Reed were announced to be charged with involuntary manslaughter in relation to the incident.
Halyna Hutchins is mourned as a rising talent in Hollywood, and her family has expressed support for the charges, emphasizing that no one is above the law.
